entry.title: KBTX Interviews Professor DePoy and REU Student

link.title: KBTX Interviews Professor DePoy and REU Student

entry.content: Professor Darren DePoy and summer research student Samantha Hudson interviewed on KBTX, discussing Texas A&M’s role in building the Giant Magellan Telescope. Watch the interview here.
entry.summary: Professor Darren DePoy and summer research student Samantha Hudson interviewed on KBTX, discussing Texas A&M’s role in building the Giant Magellan Telescope. Watch the interview here.

entry.title: Professor Jennifer Marshall Selected for MSE Project

link.title: Professor Jennifer Marshall Selected for MSE Project

entry.content: Professor Jennifer Marshall has been selected as Project Scientist for the Maunakea Spectroscopic Explorer (MSE) project! Read more here and the full article here.
entry.summary: Professor Jennifer Marshall has been selected as Project Scientist for the Maunakea Spectroscopic Explorer (MSE) project! Read more here and the full article here.

entry.title: Second Star Party at the Stella

link.title: Second Star Party at the Stella

entry.content: Professor Jennifer Marshall and the Texas A&M Astronomy Team are hosting the second star party of a three-event series at The Stella Hotel! Read more!

entry.title: Upcoming Star Parties at the Stella

link.title: Upcoming Star Parties at the Stella

entry.content: Professor Jennifer Marshall and the Texas A&M Astronomy Team are hosting three-event series star parties at The Stella slated for the third Thursday of each summer month! Read more!

entry.title: Lab Members Appear on PBS Nova

link.title: Lab Members Appear on PBS Nova

entry.content: Professor Jennifer Marshall and Erika Cook were on PBS Nova Wonders episode on dark energy and dark matter, “What’s the Universe Made Of?”
entry.summary: Professor Jennifer Marshall and Erika Cook were on PBS Nova Wonders episode on dark energy and dark matter, “What’s the Universe Made Of?”

entry.title: Texas A&M Physics and Astronomy Hosts 2018 DES Collaboration Meeting

link.title: Texas A&M Physics and Astronomy Hosts 2018 DES Collaboration Meeting

entry.content: Texas A&M Physics and Astronomy Department hosted the 2018 Dark Energy Survey (DES) collaboration meeting with contributions from many members of A&M. Click here to read more about the project.
entry.summary: Texas A&M Physics and Astronomy Department hosted the 2018 Dark Energy Survey (DES) collaboration meeting with contributions from many members of A&M. Click here to read more about the project. Click to view full size

entry.title: Announcing: Astronomy on Tap
entry.content:
We are pleased to announce the first Astronomy on Tap held in BCS will be Thursday April 12, starting at 6:30pm at Revolution Bar and Cafe in downtown Bryan. Have a beer and chat with astrophysicists! This week’s guest speakers are Dr. Nicholas Suntzeff and Peter Chi, who will talk about dark matter and the beginnings of the Universe. Spread the word! Read the full article here, and check out the event on social media!

  • Homepage
  • Facebook Event
  • Facebook Page
  • Twitter
  • Email: AoTBCS (at) gmail.com
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce the first Astronomy on Tap held in BCS will be Thursday April 12, starting at 6:30pm at Revolution Bar and Cafe in downtown Bryan. Have a beer and chat with astrophysicists! This week’s guest speakers are Dr. Nicholas Suntzeff and Peter Chi, who will talk about dark matter and the beginnings of the Universe. Spread the word! entry.title: Monumental Data Release by Dark Energy Survey

link.title: Monumental Data Release by Dark Energy Survey

entry.content: Astronomers are celebrating the monumental release of data from the Dark Energy Survey, made possible by the calibration system designed and built within Texas A&M’s Munnerlyn Astronomical Laboratory. Read the details on The Eagle and A&M Today!
entry.summary: Astronomers are celebrating the monumental release of data from the Dark Energy Survey, made possible by the calibration system designed and built within Texas A&M’s Munnerlyn Astronomical Laboratory. Read the details on The Eagle and A&M Today!

entry.title: The Battalion Features Cosmic Event
entry.content: The Battalion reports on Professor Jennifer Marshall’s observation of a historic cosmic event at a Chilean outpost, featuring interviews with Professors Lucas Macri, Jennifer Marshall, Louis Strigari, and Nicholas Suntzeff. Read more!
entry.summary: The Battalion reports on Professor Jennifer Marshall’s observation of a historic cosmic event at a Chilean outpost, featuring interviews with Professors Lucas Macri, Jennifer Marshall, Louis Strigari, and Nicholas Suntzeff. Read more!
